result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Hearing on November 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.

9:58 AM Defendant Montel L Brown in court.  Attorney Angela Wang in court for Montel L Brown.  Attorney Ted Szczupakiewicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defense requests a preliminary hearing.
The Court conducts a hearing:

Village of Menomonee Falls Police Officer Jason Cychosz sworn in and testifies on direct by Attorney Szcupakiewicz.
Cross examination by attorney Wang.  
The witness is excused and the State rests.
The Defense rests with no testimony proffered.
The Court deems testimony closed.

The State presents closing arguments and moves for bind over.
The Defense presents closing arguments and objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.

Waive reading of Information.  
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
Hearing scheduled for November 11, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 5, 2022 at 09:15 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.
